intro: Sceletium compactum, commonly known as Kanna, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant is often found in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves contain psychoactive compounds, including kanna alkaloids, which have been used traditionally by indigenous communities. The plant's unique morphology and chemical composition make it an interesting subject in both botanical and pharmacological studies.
